1.title: The Emperor's New Clothes
1.description: A vain emperor is tricked by swindlers into believing he is wearing magical clothes that only the wise can see, until a child reveals the truth.

parts.pinyin: Hěn jiǔ yǐqián, yǒu yī gè huángdì.
parts.translation: Long ago, there was an emperor.

parts.pinyin: Tā fēicháng xǐhuān chuān xīn yīfu.
parts.translation: He loved wearing new clothes very much.

parts.chinese: 每天他都要换很多次衣服。
parts.pinyin: Měi tiān tā dōu yào huàn hěn duō cì yīfu.
parts.translation: Every day he changed clothes many times.

parts.chinese: 有一天，两个骗子来到皇宫。
parts.pinyin: Yǒu yī tiān, liǎng gè piànzi lái dào huánggōng.
parts.translation: One day, two swindlers came to the palace.

parts.chinese: 他们说能织出最漂亮的衣服。
parts.pinyin: Tāmen shuō néng zhī chū zuì piàoliang de yīfu.
parts.translation: They said they could weave the most beautiful clothes.

parts.chinese: 这种衣服只有聪明人才能看见。
parts.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng yīfu zhǐ yǒu cōngmíng rén cái néng kànjiàn.
parts.translation: Only smart people could see these clothes.

parts.pinyin: Huángdì tīng le hěn gāoxìng.
parts.translation: The emperor was very happy to hear this.

parts.pinyin: Tā gěi le piànzi hěn duō qián.
parts.translation: He gave the swindlers a lot of money.

parts.pinyin: Piànzi kāishǐ jiǎzhuāng zhī bù.
parts.translation: The swindlers began to pretend to weave cloth.

parts.chinese: 皇帝派人去看衣服织得怎么样。
parts.pinyin: Huángdì pài rén qù kàn yīfu zhī de zěnmeyàng.
parts.translation: The emperor sent people to see how the clothes were being woven.

parts.pinyin: Dàchén men shénme yě kàn bù jiàn.
parts.translation: The ministers could see nothing.

parts.pinyin: Dànshì tāmen bù gǎn shuō zhēnhuà.
parts.translation: But they didn't dare tell the truth.

parts.pinyin: Tāmen dōu shuō yīfu hěn piàoliang.
parts.translation: They all said the clothes were beautiful.

parts.chinese: 皇帝穿上新衣服去游行。
parts.pinyin: Huángdì chuān shàng xīn yīfu qù yóuxíng.
parts.translation: The emperor put on the new clothes and went for a parade.

parts.chinese: 街上的人都假装看见衣服。
parts.pinyin: Jiē shàng de rén dōu jiǎzhuāng kànjiàn yīfu.
parts.translation: People on the street pretended to see the clothes.

parts.pinyin: Tūrán, yī gè xiǎo háizi shuō.
parts.translation: Suddenly, a little child said.

parts.pinyin: Huángdì méiyǒu chuān yīfu!
parts.translation: The emperor is not wearing any clothes!

parts.pinyin: Dàjiā dōu kāishǐ xiào.
parts.translation: Everyone started laughing.

parts.pinyin: Huángdì zhè cái zhīdào bèi piàn le.
parts.translation: Only then did the emperor realize he had been fooled.

parts.pinyin: Dànshì yóuxíng yǐjīng kāishǐ le.
parts.translation: But the parade had already begun.

2.title: The Turtle and the Hare
2.description: A boastful hare challenges a slow turtle to a race, but the turtle's persistence and patience lead to an unexpected victory.

parts.chinese: 从前，有一只兔子和一只乌龟。
parts.pinyin: Cóngqián, yǒu yī zhī tùzi hé yī zhī wūguī.
parts.translation: Once upon a time, there was a rabbit and a turtle.

parts.pinyin: Tùzi pǎo de hěn kuài.
parts.translation: The rabbit ran very fast.

parts.pinyin: Wūguī zǒu de hěn màn.
parts.translation: The turtle walked very slowly.

parts.pinyin: Tùzi zǒngshì cháoxiào wūguī.
parts.translation: The rabbit always made fun of the turtle.

parts.pinyin: Yǒu yī tiān, tùzi duì wūguī shuō.
parts.translation: One day, the rabbit said to the turtle.

parts.pinyin: Wǒmen lái bǐsài pǎobù ba!
parts.translation: Let's have a running race!

parts.pinyin: Wūguī tóngyì le.
parts.translation: The turtle agreed.

parts.pinyin: Bǐsài kāishǐ le.
parts.translation: The race began.

parts.pinyin: Tùzi pǎo de hěn kuài.
parts.translation: The rabbit ran very fast.

parts.pinyin: Wūguī mànmàn de zǒu.
parts.translation: The turtle walked slowly.

parts.pinyin: Tùzi hěn kuài jiù kàn bù jiàn le.
parts.translation: The rabbit quickly disappeared from sight.

parts.pinyin: Tùzi xiǎng, wǒ pǎo de zhème kuài.
parts.translation: The rabbit thought, I run so fast.

parts.pinyin: Wūguī kěndìng zhuī bù shàng wǒ.
parts.translation: The turtle definitely can't catch up to me.

parts.pinyin: Wǒ xiūxi yīxià yě méi guānxi.
parts.translation: It's okay if I rest for a while.

parts.pinyin: Tùzi tǎng xià shuìjiào le.
parts.translation: The rabbit lay down and fell asleep.

parts.pinyin: Wūguī jìxù mànmàn de zǒu.
parts.translation: The turtle continued walking slowly.

parts.pinyin: Tā yī bù yī bù de xiàng qián zǒu.
parts.translation: He walked forward step by step.

parts.pinyin: Tùzi shuì de hěn xiāng.
parts.translation: The rabbit slept soundly.

parts.pinyin: Wūguī zhōngyú dàodá le zhōngdiǎn.
parts.translation: The turtle finally reached the finish line.

parts.chinese: 兔子醒来时，比赛已经结束了。
parts.pinyin: Tùzi xǐng lái shí, bǐsài yǐjīng jiéshù le.
parts.translation: When the rabbit woke up, the race was already over.

parts.pinyin: Wūguī yíng le bǐsài.
parts.translation: The turtle won the race.

parts.pinyin: Tùzi hěn hòuhuǐ.
parts.translation: The rabbit was very regretful.

parts.pinyin: Tā míngbái le, bù néng jiāo'ào.
parts.translation: He understood that he shouldn't be arrogant.

parts.pinyin: Jiānchí jiùshì shènglì.
parts.translation: Persistence leads to victory.
